dust.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: dry powder consisting of extremely small bits of dirt that is in buildings on furniture, floors etc if they are not kept clean
dust.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: All the furniture was covered in dust.
Thereâ€™s not a speck of dust in the kitchen.
Dust particles floated in the sunlight.
A sudden breeze sent motes of dust  (=small bits of dust) dancing in the air.
Her old trophies were collecting dust on the shelves.
dust.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: dry powder consisting of extremely small bits of earth or sand
dust.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The wind was blowing dust and leaves up from the ground.
A car sped past in a cloud of dust.
dust.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: powder consisting of extremely small bits of a particular substance
dust.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: Everything was filthy and covered in dust.
Piles of old books lay on the floor gathering dust.
I brushed away the thin layer of dust which covered the picture.
By the time I'd finished cleaning, there wasn't a speck of dust anywhere.
a particle of dust/a dust particle
The air is full of dust particles.
Glittering motes of dust hung in the sunlight.
dust.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to clean the dust from a surface by moving something such as a soft cloth across it
dust.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Rachel dusted the books and the bookshelves.
I was dusting in the bedroom when the phone rang.
dust.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to remove something such as dust or dirt from your clothes by brushing them with your hands
dust.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: He got to his feet and dusted his knees.
Corbett dusted himself down and walked off.
dust.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to put a fine powder over something
dust.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: Dust the biscuits with icing sugar.
